comments.author: mark@boardmark.co.uk
comments.text:
User Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux i686) AppleWebKit/534.30 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/12.0.742.112 Safari/534.30

Steps to reproduce:

I upgraded from Firefox version 3 to 5 on Ubuntu 10.04


Actual results:

Any pages that I had looked at before the upgrade have their cache controls ignored until they are refreshed even http://www.example.com/ will only be served from the cache.
comments.raw_text:
User Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux i686) AppleWebKit/534.30 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/12.0.742.112 Safari/534.30

Steps to reproduce:

I upgraded from Firefox version 3 to 5 on Ubuntu 10.04


Actual results:

Any pages that I had looked at before the upgrade have their cache controls ignored until they are refreshed even http://www.example.com/ will only be served from the cache.

comments.creator: bugzilla@mversen.de
comments.author: bugzilla@mversen.de
comments.raw_text: I guess that clearing the disk cache under clear private data would fix this.
comments.text: I guess that clearing the disk cache under clear private data would fix this.
Yes that would fix the problem but most people won't do this after an upgrade.
comments.raw_text: Yes that would fix the problem but most people won't do this after an upgrade.
